docs.title: AI-Powered Github App To Safeguard Your Data Stack
Description
docs.text:
Data pipelines are mission-critical, but they often break - especially due to changes in upstream applications or code introduced by other teams. This is a common issue when teams don’t communicate effectively, leading to disruptions across the data stack. Troubleshooting and resolving these complex problems can take hours or even days. Cloud Avenue is an AI-powered platform designed to improve the integrity and resilience of your data pipelines by preventing issues before they occur rather than troubleshooting problems once they’re in production. Acting as an early warning system for your data pipelines, the platform offers fully automated, AI-driven proactive data lineage to track how data flows through your stack. It provides actionable insights into the impact of code changes across your entire stack. Importantly, it analyzes only metadata - not the data itself ensuring privacy and security. Cloud Avenue seamlessly integrates with a wide range of popular tools, including Fivetran, dbt, Looker, Node.js codebases, and Debezium. The platform delivers a detailed breakdown of how changes in application code impact downstream systems, helping data teams understand and address potential disruptions before they escalate. With built-in technical impact analysis, Cloud Avenue identifies functional dependencies and highlights where changes in your system might cause downstream disruptions. This proactive approach helps data teams detect and mitigate issues early in development, improving collaboration, reducing firefighting, and increasing efficiency. Cloud Avenue delivers measurable impact by minimizing downtime, accelerating development cycles, and boosting team productivity. Its automated insights reduce the need for manual troubleshooting, allowing your teams to focus on innovation rather than solving problems.

Info

After installing the app, it may take some time to initialize before you can view insights across your data stack. If you created a Cloud Avenue account, you will receive an email notification once the initialization is complete. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us at hello@cloudavenue.ai

docs.title: API Reference
docs.text:
If you would like to use our API to connect integrations or enable notifications, send a request with the required details. You can use any REST API client or refer to the instructions provided on this page: https://insights.cloudavenue.ai/api/docs

How to retrieve <AUTH_TOKEN>

Upon logging into the Cloud Avenue portal, open the developer console (usually accessed by pressing F12), navigate to the Application tab, and locate your access_token.

docs.title: Integrations
Notifications
docs.text:
Curl Examples Slack

You will need to generate Slack Webhook URL - https://api.slack.com/messaging/webhooks

curl -X 'POST' \
'https://insights.cloudavenue.ai/api/notifications/subscriptions' \
-H 'accept: application/json' \
-H 'Authorization: Bearer <AUTH_TOKEN>' \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-d '{
      "name": "slack01",
      "webhookUrl": "https://hooks.slack.com/services/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",
      "type": "slack",
      "events": [
        "pr_merged_with_impact"
      ]
}'

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: STEP 1 STEP 2 STEP 3

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Click the following link to install our GitHub app: https://github.com/apps/cloud-avenue-data-insights

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Select the repositories you want to gain insights for. We currently support repositories with Node.js, Debezium, dbt, and Looker codebases. If you would like us to support additional technologies, please feel free to reach out to us at hello@cloudavenue.ai

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: To configure additional features, such as gaining insights from platforms without GitHub repositories or enabling notifications, create an account and set them up through our portal at https://insights.cloudavenue.ai/ or via our API.

docs.title: Integrations
docs.text: You can view all connected tools and connect additional tools that don’t have code repositories in the Integrations section of our portal.

docs.title: dbt
docs.text: STEP 1 STEP 2

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Navigate to our app directly in GitHub, or click Manage in the GitHub Apps section of our portal: GitHub Apps.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Select the repositories with dbt codebases, then click Save.

docs.title: Debezium
docs.text: STEP 1 STEP 2

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Navigate to our app directly in GitHub, or click Manage in the GitHub Apps section of our portal: GitHub Apps.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Select the repositories with Debezium configurations, then click Save.

docs.title: Fivetran
docs.text: STEP 1 STEP 2

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Navigate to Integrations section of our portal and click Add Integration: Integrations.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Fill in the API Secret and Connection Details (apiKey=<API_KEY>). You can generate the API Key and Secret by visiting Fivetran’s API documentation.

docs.title: Lightdash
docs.text: STEP 1 STEP 2

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Navigate to Integrations section of our portal and click Add Integration: Integrations.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Fill in the API Secret and Connection Details (lightdashDomain=app.lightdash.cloud,projectUuid=<PROJECT_UUID>). You will need to generate a Lightdash access token and locate the project UUID by referring to Lightdash's documentation

docs.title: Looker
docs.text: STEP 1 STEP 2

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Navigate to our app directly in GitHub, or click Manage in the GitHub Apps section of our portal: GitHub Apps.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Select the repositories with Looker codebases, then click Save.

docs.title: Node.JS
docs.text: STEP 1 STEP 2

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Navigate to our app directly in GitHub, or click Manage in the GitHub Apps section of our portal: GitHub Apps.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Select the repositories with Node.js codebases, then click Save.

docs.title: Slack
docs.text: STEP 1 STEP 2

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Navigate to Notifications section of our portal and click Add Subscription: Notifications.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Fill in the name and Webhook URL. You can generate the Webhook URL by referring to Slack's documentation
